comment: Available and accessible web/app; inexpensive; relatively heavy; Well maintained; Friendly use; Appropriate.
I do not recommend it, I thought it was 24 hours 2 pounds, and it is actually every half hour 2 pounds if you do not release the bike.
If you try to return your bike and all the docks are full you have to keep on cycling till you find an empty one!
We wanted to ride around Hyde Park and surrounding parks as part of our vacation. For us, this worked well.
Does exactly what is says on the tin. £2 for every half hour you ride.
I'm super disappointed with this service.
This is an excellent way to see London by bike.
Rent it everywhere in London, for only 2 pounds a day! It is very easy to rent, just need your credit card
We used the service to cruise around Hyde Park. The bikes were well maintained and available.
What a great idea! So we needed to get to Leicester square from Regents park quickly.
Paid for 3 bikes, only got 2, charged usage on 3rd we never got.
Like many others, I thought I could rent a bike during 24 hours for 2 pounds. I was charged 16 pounds.
Hire was easy and hyde park has cycle route as does a lot of roads. Really easy for getting around and so cheap.
We used these bikes to spend 4 hours in Hyde Park. We queued up to access the bikes and so didn't read the pricing information line for line.
To rent the cycle was super easy and we used the app to find a dock with space to cycle too.
The best way to travel around the city. Cheep, smart and fast.
Not Bad!

I was really disappointed with the new system of renting bikes in London.
A total con. such a shame because a great idea...
What a super way to get around. We visited a great number of the key visitor spots around the capital with no real issues at all.
Not reliable!
Very disappointed.
I really don't know where to start in terms of describing this very in satisfying experience.
Really simple to use. Great bikes. Simply use touch screen panel, release bikes and then park at another station.
Very convenient for enjoying some fresh air on a ride round the city.
I found the system of renting a bike pretty easy to use.

Always problems...
Very good price for 24h rental.
Do not use.
The bicycles do work, but the pricing scheme is very poorly thought out, and can end up being incredibly expensive.
Disappointed with the hire, we had a hour or so to spare.
Incredibly slow and heavy - which is dangeorus in London
The bike share scheme was excellent. Easy to follow for a first time user, easy solid bikes, quick, cheap and fun!
Followed instructions but it wouldn't give me a code. However, it still took 2 pounds out of my account.
Now I'd stay well clear of them in poor weather but today it was a wonderful way to travel 7 miles across London and back again.
The pricing model is poor.
Very inexpensive, easy to checkout and check in
Overcharge
They charge you without using their services.
Simply the best way to travel (if it's not raining!) as you get a great understanding of the city and burn some of those calories.
No worth it.
My daughter and I enjoyed using the bikes, but on checking my bank account a week later, was very disapointed to find an extra £8 was charged
Disappointed!
I found this to be an easy and economical way to see a lot of of different parts of London from bicycle.
Don't use this service, it's very risky that they will charge you more than you expect!
The system was easy to use and there were bike stations all over.
They’re a bit big and heavy, but are still a great way to borrow a bike in the capital.
If you want to enjoy carefree London evening or sunny day on the bike.

This was a convenient and successful way for us to tour London.
If you used these bikes, expect to see a large charge on your card a week or so later as the result of a very poorly communicated pay scheme.
Really enjoyed using the hire cycles over the warm weekend. Very long queues however for the payment machine.
I use these bikes regularly for short journeys and enjoy using them. However, they are quite heavy, not fast and could do with better gears.
Enjoy the freedom, exercise and opportunity to see parts of London I have never seen before.
Several of the terminals were disconnected, and I was unable to hire a cycle at most of the docks I tried.
Lots more docking stations in recent years, which is good. The recent bike upgrade is pretty good too but not a significant design improvement.
Easy to use. Easy to ride. Can't wait to go back and use them again
Advertisings and guides are misleading.

The service was a brilliant touch during an absolutely mad early morning London visit!
Good experience!
Fantastic way to see the city, you need to be fairly confident riding in traffic if you're not used to it.
Loved using these bikes in London. So easy and the docking stations were everywhere.
Useless service.
Terms of rental are written in very strange form and at the end you are ripped off the price of a cost of a new bicycle.
The terminal says that it costs £2 to access the bikes for 24 hours but the truth is that you have to pay £2 for each 30 minutes journey or less.
Took out two bikes and overcharged me for one i never took out.
Once you’ve mastered the actual hire, it’s easy.
Worst service in London! Avoid by all costs.
Wow! We stayed in London for three nights and four days as a family and every single day we hired these bikes!
I always thought cycling was difficult in London. I tried it out and was proven the contrary.
These are a great idea and the hire scheme is really popular with Londoners who live/work near the stations for getting to work.
You get a bike and pay for it!!! It's works out at £2 per half hour easy as that.
Much easier than climbing all the steps to tube stations.
Generally this is an excellent scheme. The bikes are good quality and London is a fabulous City to bike in.
More expensive than they used to be if you go over the 30 minutes initial period and some of the bikes are quite tatty.
